recipes.name: Crock Pot Roast
recipes.title: Shrimp and Green Chili Grits, Simple Salad and Basic Vinaigrette
steps: Place beef roast in crock pot.
Mix the dried mixes together in a bowl and sprinkle over the roast.
Pour the water around the roast.
Cook on low for 7-9 hours.

meta.description: Don't get me started on these bad boys!  Awesome!  Yes, that's a good description!

items.title: Pimento Cheeseburgers, Roasted Gold Potatoes
items.recipeDescription: Don't get me started on these bad boys!  Awesome!  Yes, that's a good description!

recipes.name: Montreal Style Poutine
recipes.title: Baked Chicken Chimichangas, Borracho Beans

ingredients.unit_name: medium russet potatoes, sliced into sticks
salt & freshly ground black pepper, to taste
ounces cheese curds or 6 ounces fresh mozzarella cheese, diced

steps: Set the oven to 400 degrees F.
Pour 1 tablespoon of vegetable oil onto a baking sheet. Spread the oil around, then spread out the sticks of sliced potato.
Meanwhile, prepare the gravy. Melt the butter in a saucepan on medium heat.
Dice the cheese.

meta.description: Who can resist Shrimp and Grits?  I know I certainly can't!!  This is outstanding - the kiddos cleaned their plates, as did the adults.

items.title: Shrimp and Green Chili Grits, Simple Salad and Basic Vinaigrette
items.description: Who can resist Shrimp and Grits?  I know I certainly can't!!  This is outstanding - the kiddos cleaned their plates, as did the adults.

recipes.name: Sausage Rolls
recipes.title: Glazed Turkey Cutlets with Arugula, Carrot and Celery Salad, Orzo with Chives
steps: Preheat oven to 400 degrees F.
Roll pastry out into a thin rectangle; cut lengthwise into 2 long strips.
Divide sausage into 2 portions, dust with flour, and form long rolls about the same length as the pastry.
Place sausage in the middle of the pastry strips; brush pastry edges with milk, then seal long edge.

meta.description: This is a must-try!  When everyone tried this, I heard comments like, 'this is the best thing I've ever tasted.'  Well, does that convince you?  And the Chimichangas are baked, not fried, so much healthier than the restaurants.  Total deliciousness!!

items.title: Slow-Cooker Pork Ragout, Buttered Pappardelle, Blistered Okra
items.description: Many of you have requested slow-cooker meals, and yes, I must agree that they are perfect for busy days.  Set it and forget it!  Boneless pork ribs turn out fork-tender, with a rich-tasting sauce, which is perfect over pasta or rice.

items.title: Glazed Turkey Cutlets with Arugula, Carrot and Celery Salad, Orzo with Chives
items.description: This is the ticket to those crazy weeknights, when you need something on the table in a hurry.  If you've never eaten turkey cutlets, I urge you to give them a try.  But of course, chicken breasts pounded thin would work as well.  Who knew something so easy could be so delish?

items.title: Bruschetta with Fresh Figs and Goat Cheese
items.description: A perfect way to use the gorgeous figs available right now.  This looks so elegant but it so easy to put together.  Everyone raved...and I think you will as well.  Enjoy!!

recipes.name: Ecuadorean Shrimp Ceviche with Oranges
recipes.title: Ecuadorean Shrimp Ceviche with Oranges
steps: Preheat the oven to 500 degrees.
Place the tomato, jalapenos, bell pepper and onion, cut sides down, on the pan.
Remove the shrimp from the pot, place in a colander and run very cold water over the shrimp.
Taste and season with Tabasco and salt to taste. Pour the sauce over the shrimp and toss.

recipes.name: Stir-Fried Shrimp in Garlic Sauce
recipes.title: Stir-Fried Shrimp in Garlic Sauce
steps: In a small bowl, mix together chicken broth, vinegar, soy sauce, sesame oil, chile paste (if using) and sherry; set aside.
In another small bowl or cup, stir together the tbsp of cornstarch with the 3 tbsp of water and set aside.
Heat the oil over medium-high heat in a wok; add ginger and garlic and sizzle briefly, then add vegetables and Thai chilies (if using).
Stir-fry vegetables for approximately 3 minutes, then add the shrimp.
Cook the shrimp 2 minutes or until it curls and turns opaque or pink.

recipes.name: Tartiflette -- the indulgent version
recipes.title: Tartiflette -- the indulgent version

ingredients.unit_name: lb swiss cheese or 1 lb emmenthaler cheese or 1 lb jarlsberg cheese, grated

steps: Saute onions and salt pork in some butter.
Grease a gratin dish with some butter, then put a layer of potatoes, salt and pepper.
Spread the cooked onions and salt pork, then half of the cheese.
Cover with another layer of potatoes, salt and pepper.
Bake at 350F for about 30 minutes.
